intro: Phyllagathis phyllioides, commonly known as the broad-leaved phyllagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
